segment.source: Edit AppLocker rules (Windows 10)
segment.target: Edit AppLocker rules (Windows 10)

segment.source: This topic for IT professionals describes the steps to edit a publisher rule, path rule, and file hash rule in AppLocker.
segment.target: This topic for IT professionals describes the steps to edit a publisher rule, path rule, and file hash rule in AppLocker.

segment.source: Edit AppLocker rules
segment.target: Edit AppLocker rules

segment.source: Applies to
segment.target: Applies to

segment.source: Windows 10
segment.target: Windows 10

segment.source: This topic for IT professionals describes the steps to edit a publisher rule, path rule, and file hash rule in AppLocker.
segment.target: This topic for IT professionals describes the steps to edit a publisher rule, path rule, and file hash rule in AppLocker.

segment.source: For more info about these rule types, see Understanding AppLocker rule condition types.
segment.target: For more info about these rule types, see Understanding AppLocker rule condition types.

segment.source: You can perform this task by using the Group Policy Management Console for an AppLocker policy in a Group Policy Object (GPO) or by using the Local Security Policy snap-in for an AppLocker policy on a local computer or in a security template.
segment.target: You can perform this task by using the Group Policy Management Console for an AppLocker policy in a Group Policy Object (GPO) or by using the Local Security Policy snap-in for an AppLocker policy on a local computer or in a security template.

segment.source: For info how to use these MMC snap-ins to administer AppLocker, see Administer AppLocker.
segment.target: For info how to use these MMC snap-ins to administer AppLocker, see Administer AppLocker.

segment.source: To edit a publisher rule
segment.target: To edit a publisher rule

segment.source: Open the AppLocker console, and then click the appropriate rule collection.
segment.target: Open the AppLocker console, and then click the appropriate rule collection.

segment.source: In the Action pane, right-click the publisher rule, and then click Properties.
segment.target: In the Action pane, right-click the publisher rule, and then click Properties.

segment.source: Click the appropriate tab to edit the rule properties.
segment.target: Click the appropriate tab to edit the rule properties.

segment.source: Click the General tab to change the rule name, add a rule description, configure whether the rule is used to allow or deny applications, and set the security group for which this rule should apply.
segment.target: Click the General tab to change the rule name, add a rule description, configure whether the rule is used to allow or deny applications, and set the security group for which this rule should apply.

segment.source: Click the Publisher tab to configure the certificate's common name, the product name, the file name, or file version of the publisher.
segment.target: Click the Publisher tab to configure the certificate's common name, the product name, the file name, or file version of the publisher.

segment.source: Click the Exceptions tab to create or edit exceptions.
segment.target: Click the Exceptions tab to create or edit exceptions.

segment.source: When you finish updating the rule, click OK.
segment.target: When you finish updating the rule, click OK.

segment.source: To edit a file hash rule
segment.target: To edit a file hash rule

segment.source: Open the AppLocker console, and then click the appropriate rule collection.
segment.target: Open the AppLocker console, and then click the appropriate rule collection.

segment.source: Choose the appropriate rule collection.
segment.target: Choose the appropriate rule collection.

segment.source: In the Action pane, right-click the file hash rule, and then click Properties.
segment.target: In the Action pane, right-click the file hash rule, and then click Properties.

segment.source: Click the appropriate tab to edit the rule properties.
segment.target: Click the appropriate tab to edit the rule properties.

segment.source: Click the General tab to change the rule name, add a rule description, configure whether the rule is used to allow or deny applications, and set the security group in which this rule should apply.
segment.target: Click the General tab to change the rule name, add a rule description, configure whether the rule is used to allow or deny applications, and set the security group in which this rule should apply.

segment.source: Click the File Hash tab to configure the files that should be used to enforce the rule.
segment.target: Click the File Hash tab to configure the files that should be used to enforce the rule.

segment.source: You can click Browse Files to add a specific file or click Browse Folders to add all files in a specified folder.
segment.target: You can click Browse Files to add a specific file or click Browse Folders to add all files in a specified folder.

segment.source: To remove hashes individually, click Remove.
segment.target: To remove hashes individually, click Remove.

segment.source: When you finish updating the rule, click OK.
segment.target: When you finish updating the rule, click OK.

segment.source: To edit a path rule
segment.target: To edit a path rule

segment.source: Open the AppLocker console, and then click the appropriate rule collection.
segment.target: Open the AppLocker console, and then click the appropriate rule collection.

segment.source: Choose the appropriate rule collection.
segment.target: Choose the appropriate rule collection.

segment.source: In the Action pane, right-click the path rule, and then click Properties.
segment.target: In the Action pane, right-click the path rule, and then click Properties.

segment.source: Click the appropriate tab to edit the rule properties.
segment.target: Click the appropriate tab to edit the rule properties.

segment.source: Click the General tab to change the rule name, add a rule description, configure whether the rule is used to allow or deny applications, and set the security group in which this rule should apply.
segment.target: Click the General tab to change the rule name, add a rule description, configure whether the rule is used to allow or deny applications, and set the security group in which this rule should apply.

segment.source: Click the Path tab to configure the path on the computer in which the rule should be enforced.
segment.target: Click the Path tab to configure the path on the computer in which the rule should be enforced.

segment.source: Click the Exceptions tab to create exceptions for specific files in a folder.
segment.target: Click the Exceptions tab to create exceptions for specific files in a folder.

segment.source: When you finish updating the rule, click OK.
segment.target: When you finish updating the rule, click OK.
